listings.name: Summer Escape! Park Resident Volunteer Opportunity July-Sept., 2025
listings.description:
Access the application here: https://volunteers.floridastateparks.org/pages/oneclick/agv0d4f4juMz3Yn1fjGickFwmSOwUF6N

Lush pine forests and soft sandy beaches are what surround your work environment here at Bald Point State Park! Whether your passion is public speaking, maintenance, or gardening we strive to help every volunteer find their passions in their day to day work. Come experience the beauty of nature this summer in a place where you can help make a difference.

REQUIRED SKILLS & ABILITIES.

Visitor Services: A willingness and desire to help others, customer service experience, excellent communication skills with the ability to speak and to interact with visitors in a friendly manner.

Administration: Follow verbal and written instructions. Communicate effectively, and answer visitor inquiries in a courteous manner. This is a fun and busy opportunity for a people-oriented person to make a positive first impression with visitors.

Maintenance: Maintain cleanliness of park grounds and facilities including, but not limited to campsite/restroom cleaning, and trash collection/removal. Perform preventative and corrective maintenance on park equipment and facilities, including buildings, vehicles, paths, grills, boardwalks, bridges, docks, tractors, and small equipment. Inform rangers of potential problems. Trim vegetation as directed by management to maintain aesthetics and safety of persons and property. Operate tools and equipment for the job (training provided). Ability to lift 25 lbs.

Resource Management: Control native, invasive, and exotic vegetation by mechanical removal or herbicides. Monitor and protect wildlife and natural areas. Monitor and report observations of flowering plants and wildlife. Work on restoring native habitat with a variety of methods.

Protection: Ensure park rules are interpreted in a friendly yet effective manner. Maintain a constant lookout for safety concerns and take appropriate action to correct and/or report to rangers in a timely, effective manner. Wear proper protective equipment.

SCHEDULING REQUIREMENTS

Park residents and campground hosts are required to contribute 24 hours per week per campsite (can be split among others on the site) to receive the free RV site.

Usually, 3 to 4 days per week .

Months commitment for no more than 16 weeks at a park in a 12-month period starting at first day of occupancy.

TRAINING/PRE-REQUISITS

Pass National and Florida sexual offender checks

Have a valid drivers license

You may be asked to provide an alternate valid form of identification

Safety training will be on-going and provided by the park

In the Volunteer Portal, have a Volunteer Application, a current Volunteer Agreement, and Volunteer DEP Annual Combo Training (diversity, sexual harassment, & workers' compensation), both renewed annually

VOLUNTEER AMENITIES

Full hook-ups 50/30 Amp electrical service, water, and sewer or dump station

Washer, dryer, ice machine

BENEFITS

You will be provided a Volunteer T-shirt and a nametag

Upon completing your first 50 hours, you will receive a free entrance pass* to the park you currently serve and 6 visits for you and your family to any other state park

Upon completing 250 hours, you will receive a special volunteer annual pass for you and your family to any Florida State Park (*request passes from the Volunteer Manager. Some restrictions apply)

Join us in park staff gatherings (i.e., potlucks, celebrations, holiday parties, etc.)

Be a part of the Florida Park Service family, working alongside like-minded staff and volunteers

You have the opportunity for personal enrichment and experience working in a unique state park setting

Access the application here: https://volunteers.floridastateparks.org/pages/oneclick/agv0d4f4juMz3Yn1fjGickFwmSOwUF6N

The Barnacle Historic State Park is looking to recruit people who would like to volunteer. We have wonderful volunteer opportunities here at our park for those who are looking to give back to the community. Our park is one of many natural habitats in Coconut Grove. We couldnâ€™t preserve and maintain these important natural and cultural resources without the significant support of volunteers and the local community.

Grounds maintenance is one of the most important roles for volunteers, because you will see the beauty of this place overlooking Biscayne Bay, observe the habitat of many wild animals and birdâ€™s native to the area, and see what the once expansive "Miami Hammock" ecology was like back in the late 1800s.

listings.name: Gate Attendant
listings.description:
This beautiful house with a whimsical name dates back to a simpler time. The Barnacle Historic Stae Park offers a glimpse of frontier life during the Era of the Bay, when all travel to and from Miami was by sea. Situated on the shore of Biscayne Bay, this was the home of Ralph Middleton Munroe, one of Coconut Grove's most charming and influential pioneers. Munroe preserved the forest on his land, cutting out only a winding buggy trail through the hammock barely wide enough for one vehicle. As a result, the property contains many large, old trees.

Left in its natural state, The Barnacle Historic State Park appears much as it did in Munroe's day. The Barnacle is a great place to enjoy simple pleasures: an outdoor concert; a picnic on the lawn; walking with the family dog down a tree-lined path; or rocking in a chair on the spacious front porch and watching the sailboats go by.

listings.name: Social Media Volunteer in Galapagos
listings.description:
Role Overview

We dedicate ourselves to conservation and education to help isolated communities grow in a sustainable way - and we need you to help us convey that message! Whether it is getting photographs to accurately depict the work we do or videos of the stunning wildlife on Isabela Island, you will be capturing the essence of our work and disseminating it to our local and international communities, and spreading it to future volunteers, donors, and collaborators to excite them about IOI.

At the same time this project is part of a Galapagos Government Council project that seeks to strengthen small, local entrepreneurs so that through the use of social networks they can generate conten and a greater reach of their project. As a volunteer you will help and support local community members and their businesses get their products and message on social media or public by other means (flyers, brochures, etc.).

Your responsabilities will greatly depend on your skills and experience, as well as on the needs of IOI and/or the business that you will be working with. Your tasks may include generating footage (photo and film) and text that accurately and meaningfully captures the nature of IOI or the business and its product(s), or perhaps designing a flyer, or social media strategy. The possibilities will vary!

Schedule

Schedules are based on a 25 hr/week commitment, and can voluntarily be extended to a regular 40hr/work week.

Typically Monday-Friday 8:30-11:30AM; and 2:00-4:00. May be subject to change depending on the tasks at hand

Requirements
  • Experience in Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. Please keep in mind you may not be posting directly to these sites.
  • An understanding of camera equipment and Mac or PC
  • Ability to work independently as well as in a team
  • Be a great verbal and written communicator
  • An understanding of social media platforms, blogging, Photoshop, and web-design.

Whatâ€™s Included

Cost includes full room and board, work permits, Galapagos visa, local coordination and training at respective facility, local transport, full access to our facilities, National Park certificates, etc. - everything minus personal expenses, travel insurance, and your airfare to GalÃ¡pagos.

Accommodation

Accommodation is provided in our fully equipped volunteer housing or by one of our carefully selected host families. These are families who have experience with outside culture and international living through cultural exchange with our students and volunteers. Additionally to providing extra income for housing our students and volunteers, we train these families to be ambassadors in the community in areas such as English, domestic wellbeing, and nutrition.

You will have breakfast and dinner with your family. Lunch is provided at your choice of various restaurants in town. You simply sign for your meal and weâ€™ll pick up the bill at the end of the month. For volunteer housing breakfast is not included. Lunch and dinner is provided in your choice of restaurant.

Terms

We encourage all volunteers to stay as long as possible to maximize local and personal benefit. We encourage longer commitments by heavily discounting each additional week stayed. Minimum of 2 weeks to work on this project.; maximum stay is 3 months. Subsequent permanent hiring possible. All volunteers must arrive to Isabela on Mondays.

Please contact us for more info.

listings.name: Sustainable Farming & Urban Agriculture in Galapagos
listings.description:
Role Overview

The farms of Isabela Island are starting work in greenhouses to optimize production year-round in a sustainable and environmentally friendly way. The highland town of TomÃ¡s de Berlanga is about 10 miles uphill from the coastal part of town, where IOI headquarters,your accommodations, social life, and the beach are located. Located on the side of Volcano Sierra Negra, the highlands are fertile, lush lands with rich volcanic soil - perfect for agriculture!

Volunteers will learn local techniques for sustainable tropical agriculture and will help to create food sovereignty, lower the carbon footprint of island life, lower waste from shipping materials, lowers cost to local consumers, increase local income, and increase the nutritional content of the food available in Isabela.

Schedule

Our schedules are based on 30 hrs/week. It is about a 30-minute bus ride up to the highlands at 7:00am and the bus leaves the highlands around 2:30pm.

After you arrive back to Isabela at 3:00pm you will have the rest of the day to explore, adventure, or rest on the beach. You can enjoy food at one of the local restaurants or spend the afternoon playing volleyball, hanging out with your host family (if you choose) or watching the sunset from the beach.

Requirements

  • Conversational+ level of Spanish is ideal.
  • Ability to work independently as well as in a team.
  • Flexible schedule that accounts for the day to day needs of working with a local institution.
  • Physical ability to work outdoors with potentially high sun, element, and temperature exposure.
  • Volunteers will be provided with materials they need.

listings.name: Fishing line recycling station adoption
listings.description:
Help us keep fishing line out of Tampa Bay!

Tampa Bay Watch partners with the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC) in their statewide initiative to recycle used fishing line through a network of monofilament collection tubes called "monotubes". Monofilament or "mono", is another term for the commonly used plastic fishing line which has great fishing utility, but takes over 600 years to break down! Improperly discarded line can end up in our local ecosystems and may result in wildlife entanglement, accidental hooks, and ingestion. Letâ€™s keep fishing line out of our waterways!

Adoption involves checking your designated location once a month to empty its contents and clean/prep the collected line for recycling. We are asking that volunteers commit a minimum of one year for any chosen site. The clean line will be contributed to FWC's statewide initiative for proper recycling and repurposing of used fishing line. Go to our webpage to learn more about our monofilament recycling program: https:// tampabaywatch.org/marine- debris/fishing-line-recycling/ .
Take action to combat marine debris and protect our wildlife by adopting monotubes! We have one site available:

Skyway Fishing Pier South Side - 28 tubes - great opportunity for a family or group!

listings.name: Volunteer Board Member at The Henry Nehrling Society Inc. DBA Nehrling Gardens
listings.description:
In 1885, Dr. Henry Nehrling, one of Floridaâ€™s pioneer horticulturists and naturalists, purchased 65 acres in central Florida in the newly settled German-American town of Gotha to develop one of Floridaâ€™s first tropical gardens. An early conservationist, Nehrling wrote in 1904, "It is high time to protect and preserve what is still left." The Mission of the Henry Nehrling Society is to preserve Dr. Nehrlingâ€™s historic home and gardens in Gotha, Florida, and to educate, inspire and create awareness about the intrinsic value of Florida's horticultural history, of its plants and birds, and of the community's cultural heritage; and to assist in the conservation and protection of natural resources in Central Florida.

We are looking for additional board members who are passionate about nature, giving back to the community while preserving history and establishing accessible green spaces for all.

General Requirements:

  • Support The Henry Nehrling Societyâ€™s mission, purposes, goals, governance policies, and programs, while knowing its strengths and needs.
  • Attend monthly board meetings.
  • Serve actively on a board committee.
  • Attend activities and events supporting The Henry Nehrling Societyâ€™s mission and goals.

Qualifications:

  • Basic computer literacy and knowledge of Microsoft and Google products.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work well in a team environment.
  • Motivation to bring ideas to the table that will benefit Nehrling Gardens and the community.
  • We are looking for board members with diverse experience and background. However, special attention will be given to candidates with experience in Marketing, Fundraising or Grant Writing.

If you are interested in joining our board, please email your resume with a cover letter explaining why you want to sever on the board to volunteer@nehrlinggardens.org

listings.name: Garden volunteer at Nehrling Gardens in Gotha
listings.description:
Join us as a garden volunteer us at Nehrling Gardens in Gotha to assist in keeping the property looking beautiful!

Under the guidance of our seasoned volunteers, you can chose which area to focus on, tasks involve: pulling weeds, clearing brush, planting new plants, raking, landscaping, etc. Individuals interested in volunteering with the gardens are welcome to attend on Wednesdays from 8am-12pm or on the 1st and 2nd Saturday of the month.

The Nehrling Gardens Society is a 501c(3) non-profit organization benefiting the community focusing on Historic Preservation, Horticultural Education and Environmental Conservation.

More about our history...

Nehrling Gardens is the former home of famed horticulturalist Henry Nehrling, who purchased the property in 1885 to establish a garden where he could experiment with tropical and subtropical plants year round.

Nehrling Gardens is the former home of famed horticulturalist Henry Nehrling, who purchased the property in 1885 to establish a garden where he could experiment with tropical and subtropical plants year round. It is located in Gotha, Florida, a small community near Orlando that was founded by German Americans in the 1870s. The 1880s Florida wood frame vernacular style home and semi-detached kitchen were moved by ox-cart to the site in the early 1900s, when Nehrling moved his family to Florida.

This particular garden was one of Floridaâ€™s earliest experimental botanical gardens where Dr. Nehrling tested over 3,000 new and rare plants for the Bureau of Plant Industry, now known as the USDA. By the early 1900s it was a popular destination for thousands of tourists, nature lovers, and new Florida settlers. Many prominent people of the era, such as Theodore Roosevelt, Thomas Edison, Liberty Hyde Bailey, Theodore Mead and Dr. David Fairchild, marveled at the garden and celebrated Nehrlingâ€™s extraordinary work.

Of the 40 plus acres purchased by Henry Nehrling between 1885 and 1897, only the 6-acre homestead site remains; a portion of which extends into Lake Nally. Specimens of the original 100-year old tree canopy and many of his plantings still exists as well as the original home - a charming and authentic example of pioneer Florida life.

The Henry Nehrling Society was formed in 1999 in order to save and purchase the property - a mission that was accomplished in 2009. Now, the gardens are owned and operated by the non-profit corporationâ€™s volunteer board and staff.

Today, Nehrling Gardens continues to enrich our lives as a community resource and education center focused on historic preservation, horticultural education and environmental conservation.

listings.name: Help Fight Hunger and Food Waste in South FL! Food Rescuer Needed
listings.description:
More than 40 million individuals, including 9 million children, are food insecure in the United States.

Grocery prices have jumped 12% in the past year; the sharpest increase since 1979.

The need for our work has never been more vital.

Food Rescue US is dedicated to eliminating hunger and food waste (keeping food out of landfills and reducing greenhouse gasses). We engage volunteers and food donors through our proprietary web-based app to directly transfer nutritious excess food to social service agencies serving the food insecure. Food Rescue US is a national organization with 40+ sites across 20+ states and DC.

Food Rescue US is a leader in reducing both hunger and food waste in America by transforming a negative, food waste, into a positive, delivering fresh, healthy food to millions of people through our community of dedicated volunteer food rescuers.

Food rescuers pick-up excess food from local food donors, including grocery stores, restaurants, corporate dining facilities, and other food providers, and deliver it to local social service agencies providing for the food insecure. Rescuers use their own vehicles and select times that are convenient for them to pick-up and drop-off the excess food.

The process is quick, simple, and incredibly rewarding. Interested in getting involved? Sign up at FoodRescue.us to start today and see a complete schedule of local food rescue opportunities.

listings.name: Ranger Station Attendant (year-round)
listings.description:
Enjoy one of Florida's most beautiful state parks while volunteering at Alfred B. Maclay Gardens State Park, located in the heart of Tallahassee, FL. We are seeking reliable local volunteers to assist at the front entrance in the Ranger Station.

This position would be responsible for the following tasks:

  • Collect day use fees using a point-of-sale terminal
  • Answer visitor questions in person and over the phone
  • Assist visitors with facility rentals, annual pass sales and after-hours permits.
  • Operate a two-way radio system to contact field staff

Please indicate on your application any special skills or trainings you have that would be relevant to this position, including cash handling, customer service and computer skills. We will teach you everything else you need to know about park operations!

We ask that volunteers in this position work one 6 to 7-hour shift per week minimum, preferably on the same day and time each week. Ranger station shifts are typically from 7:30 AM-1:30 PM or 1:00 PM-7:00 PM, depending on sunset/park closing times.

You will be provided a volunteer nametag and t-shirt. Upon completion of your first 50 hours, you will receive a free entrance pass to the park you currently serve and 6 visits for you and your family to any other state park. Upon completion of 250 hours, you will receive a special volunteer annual pass for you and your family to any Florida State Park. Join us in all park staff gatherings (i.e., potlucks, celebrations, holiday parties, etc.) and the annual district Volunteer Appreciation gathering.

Direct application link here: https://volunteers.floridastateparks.org/pages/oneclick/HHNY5QcdHdchF6PbwObp3pJb46XoGb13

listings.name: Garden Volunteer (year-round)
listings.description:
Enjoy one of Florida's most beautiful state parks while volunteering at Alfred B. Maclay Gardens State Park, located in the heart of Tallahassee, FL. We are seeking reliable local volunteers to join our garden crew.

Examples of assigned tasks include:

  • Pruning and weed pulling
  • Debris pickup
  • Vine pulling and removal
  • Watering and planting
  • Mowing
  • Spread pine-straw and mulch
  • Greenhouse work

Please indicate on your application any special skills or training you have that would be relevant to this position, including:

  • Prior landscape experience
  • Knowledge of irrigation systems
  • Ability to identify plant species

We ask that volunteers in this position work a minimum of one 4 to 5-hour shift per week, preferably on the same day and time each week.

You will be provided a Volunteer T-shirt and a nametag. Upon completion of your first 50 hours, you will receive a free entrance pass to the park you currently serve and 6 visits for you and your family to any other state park. Upon completion of 250 hours, you will receive a special volunteer annual pass for you and your family to any Florida State Park. Join us in all park staff gatherings (i.e., potlucks, celebrations, holiday parties, etc.) and the annual district Volunteer Appreciation gathering.

Private Group Details:

  • Group Size Range: 1 - 20
  • Event can be held at organization location(s)
  • No Donation

1 shift available:

  • Monday June 23, 2025 - 08:00 to 13:00 EST

listings.name: Become a Natural Areas Site Steward
listings.description:
Do you care about wildlife and the environment? Help a group of conservation professionals at Palm Beach County Department of Environmental Resource Management maintain and protect Palm Beach County Natural Areas! Monitor a natural area site within the County on a regular basis and report issues including trail conditions, invasive species, and visitor perspective. No experience is necessary. Volunteers are also able to assist with scheduled cleanups, restorative projects, exotic controls, and other events on site.

To expedite the onboarding process, please complete the Volunteer Application which can be found on the PBC ERM website: https://discover.pbcgov.org/erm/Pages/Natural-Areas-Site-Steward.aspx.

Join us for a series of Garden Work Days at the FAMU/City of West Palm Beach community gardens! Weâ€™re looking for helping hands to weed, plant, mulch, prune, harvest and beautify the space..... listings.name: Fight Food Waste and Food Insecurity: Be a Food Rescuer in SW Florida!
listings.description:
More than 47 million individuals, including 9 million children, are food insecure in the United States. At the same time, 40% of food in the food system is WASTED!

The need for our work has never been more vital.

Food Rescue US is dedicated to reducing hunger and food waste (keeping food out of landfills and reducing greenhouse gasses). We engage volunteers and food donors through our proprietary web-based app to directly transfer nutritious excess food to social service agencies serving the food insecure. Food Rescue US is a national organization with 40+ sites across 20+ states and DC.

Food rescuers pick-up excess food from local food donors, including grocery stores, restaurants, corporate dining facilities, and other food providers, and deliver it to local social service agencies providing for the food insecure. Rescuers use their own vehicles and select rescues scheduled at times that are convenient for them to pick-up and drop-off the excess food.

The process is quick, simple, and incredibly rewarding. Interested in getting involved? Sign up at FoodRescue.us to start today and see a complete schedule of local food rescue opportunities.

listings.name: Marketing Volunteer Role: Expand Access to Ocean Education!
listings.description:
The general publicâ€™s knowledge about ocean-related issues is alarmingly low both nationally and internationally. A 2005 study, "Environmental Literacy in America," estimated that less than 2% of all American adults are environmentally literate. Another 2018 study, "Development of the International Ocean Literacy Survey," found that the American public is more literate about video games and gambling than our worldâ€™s oceans. Oceans provide vital ecosystem services, yet many schools lack the resources to teach these issues, leaving students and adults alike without the knowledge to drive future ocean conservation.

Breach's programs seek to fill this gap by engaging youth, educational institutions, and the general public in digital ocean education. Programs like our digital podcast, Shellphone, allow us to highlight content from ocean educators, enhance in-school curricula, and connect with broad audiences. This month, Breach will be piloting our latest educational program Ocean Class, within the Hillsborough County and greater Tampa Bay school system. Since all of our programs are delivered digitally, we have an abundance of valuable content-but no clear, strategic structure for sharing it. This is where you come in!

Breach is pleased to submit a proposal to students and interested volunteers to expand our programs Shellphone and Ocean Class. We are specifically seeking strategies focused on video or reel based content over social media platforms like Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube shorts to reach young adult audiences. Deliverables would include campaign concepts, engagement tactics and monetization roadmaps tailored to these platforms, with the goal of increasing visibility, audience growth, and program registrations.

Please apply here: https://forms.monday.com/forms/a4d682698a507710f82a52ad4ea75c1d?r=use1

listings.name: Help shelter animals from home!
listings.description:
Project Canis is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization started by students at the University of Florida to ensure that every shelter animal has a toy. â€‹Project Canis helps cats and dogs in Florida shelters by making and donating pet toys made from recycled materials. Many animal shelters struggle to get donations and are not financially able to provide toys, which are essential to animals' emotional and physical well-being.

Anyone can participate in Project Canis remotely by sending in toys they made individually or as a service project with their organization. We have three toy designs: the braid, the plushie, and the crunch that can be made easily with recycled materials such as old t-shirts and plastic water bottles. Making the toys is super easy and fun, and participating in Project Canis is a great way for anyone to give back to the community.

To volunteer with Project Canis, all you have to do is use our easy toy-making instructions found here: https://www.projectcanis.org/volunteer.html

Once you have made your toys, you can mail them to us, and we will mail you back a free sticker! If you want a record of your service hours or if you instead donate your toys to a local shelter, please email us at theprojectcanis@gmail.com with the number of toys you made and where you donated them.

Follow us @theprojectcanis on Facebook and Instagram, and send in your own toy-making photos to be featured!

listings.name: Outreach and Relationship Coordinator
listings.description:
We are seeking a passionate and dedicated Volunteer Outreach Coordinator to help us build a comprehensive online directory for farms and farmers markets across the nation, with a particular focus on the Southeast region. As an Outreach Coordinator, you will play a crucial role in connecting with farms and farmers markets, showcasing the benefits of our directory, and encouraging their participation. If you enjoy building relationships, making connections, and supporting local agriculture, we invite you to join our team and contribute to the growth of a sustainable food system across the nation.

Responsibilities:

  1. Outreach Strategy and Planning:

    • Develop a strategic outreach plan to engage with farms and farmers markets nationwide, focusing on the Southeast region initially.
    • Collaborate with the team to identify target farms and farmers markets for outreach efforts.
    • Create effective call and email scripts, follow-up strategies, and tracking methods for outreach activities.

  2. Relationship Building and Engagement:

    • Initiate contact with farms and farmers markets across the nation through phone calls, emails, and other communication channels.
    • Clearly articulate the value and advantages of being listed in our nationwide online directory.
    • Build rapport and establish positive relationships with potential participants.
    • Address inquiries, provide assistance, and guide farms and farmers markets through the registration process.

  3. Communication and Follow-Up:

    • Maintain accurate records of all outreach activities, including contact details, responses, and next steps.
    • Follow up with farms and farmers markets to provide additional information and support as needed.
    • Respond promptly to inquiries and provide exceptional customer service throughout the outreach process.
    • Coordinate with the team to ensure seamless integration of farms and farmers markets into the online directory.

  4. Feedback and Improvement:

    • Collect feedback from farms and farmers markets to improve the outreach process and enhance the online directory's features.
    • Collaborate with the team to implement suggestions and incorporate new ideas into the directory's development.

Requirements:

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to establish connections and build relationships.
  • Comfortable with making phone calls and sending professional emails.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills to effectively manage nationwide outreach efforts.
  • Passionate about supporting local agriculture and fostering community connections.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team, coordinating efforts with the directory development team.
  • Proficiency in using communication tools such as email, phone, and customer relationship management (CRM) systems.

Benefits:

  • Contribute to the growth and development of a nationwide online directory that supports farms and farmers markets.
  • Develop and enhance your communication and relationship-building skills.
  • Network and connect with farmers and community members across the nation.
  • Gain insights into local agriculture and sustainable food systems from various regions.
  • Play a vital role in promoting community engagement and supporting local farmers nationwide.

Join our team of dedicated volunteers and help us build a comprehensive online directory that connects consumers with farms and farmers markets across the nation. Your outreach efforts will empower local agriculture, strengthen community connections, and contribute to a sustainable and inclusive food system.

Anyone can participate in Project Canis remotely by sending in toys they made individually or as a service project with their organization. We have three toy designs: the braid, the plushie, and the crunch that can be made easily with recycled materials such as old t-shirts and plastic water bottles. Making the toys is super easy and fun, and participating in Project Canis is a great way for organizations to give back to the community.

To volunteer with Project Canis, all you have to do is use our easy toy-making instructions found here: https://www.projectcanis.org/volunteer.html

Once you have made your toys, you can mail them to us, and we will mail you back a free sticker! If you want a record of your service hours or if you instead donate your toys to a local shelter, please email us at theprojectcanis@gmail.com with the number of toys you made and where you donated them.

Follow us @theprojectcanis on Facebook and Instagram, and send in your own toy-making photos to be featured!

Private Group Details:

  • Event can be held at a volunteer group location (e.g. office, park)
  • Event can be held at organization location(s)
  • Event can be held virtually
  • No Donation

Responsibilities:

listings.description:
Tampa Bay Watch is seeking the help of a few tenacious volunteers to support our Shells for Shorelines program to assist in collecting oyster shell donations from our partner restaurants on a weekly basis: Monday - Friday during business hours. listings.name: Reef Ball Installation
listings.description:
Be a part of the Fred Crabill Fantasy Island Project! The project honors CCA Florida Life Legacy member and conservationist Fred Crabill and will create oyster reef habitat in an effort to increase biodiversity, reduce erosion and improve water quality in Tampa Bay. This project marks a significant step forward in enhancing the areaâ€™s shoreline resilience and protecting vital fish habitats. Click here to read more about living shorelines.

The meeting location is Williams Park boat ramp, 9425 US Hwy 41, Riverview, FL.

The project will involve the installation of oyster reef balls which is a heavy project as reef balls weigh 200 pounds each. Two people share the weight of each reef ball at a time to install it on the shoreline via boats and/or carts. The minimum age to volunteer is 16 years old.

listings.description:
Nursery volunteers assist our Animal Care Staff by doing laundry, washing dishes, cleaning cages, walking tortoises, preparing diets, assembling syringes, sweeping/mopping floors, and other general hospital cleaning. These tasks are really important because they make up the bulk of the animal care, making sure that we have clean blankets for animals to snuggle into and clean food bowls for their diets.

After completing 30 hours, volunteers have the opportunity to join the Release Team and help take animals back to their homes after they are done with their rehabilitation.

After 100 hours, volunteers may be able to help in other areas based on their reliability and skill level.

listings.name: Project Leader: Multimedia Specialist
listings.description:
• This is an unpaid volunteer opportunity.
  • Project Leaders are expected to put in a minimum of 8 hours per week and be responsive to emails within 36 hours.
  • STW(tm) welcomes volunteers who are seeking skill-based volunteering opportunities. STW(tm) shall provide a "letter of recommendation" to professionals who demonstrate outstanding contributions for professional references.

SUMMARY:

Reporting to the Marketing Director, the Project Leader: Multimedia Specialist will work closely with the Marketing team, Curriculum Development and Education Content teams, and be responsible for the design and development of multimedia materials to support the needs of the Education Group.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Designs and produces multimedia content needed to support ongoing projects and education initiatives.
  • Develops customized multimedia materials to support joint digital fundraising and public awareness campaigns in collaboration with the Education Group and other groups at Save the Water, potentially including any external partners.
  • Manage multimedia projects and delegate tasks to Multimedia Specialist(s).
  • Work directly with the Curriculum Development and Education Content teams, in consultation with Managers, Associate Directors, and Directors in creating digital designs and engaging content.
  • Ensure compliance with: copyright and intellectual property, quality assurance, and Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) or its equivalent in the development of instructional media materials.
  • Supports Curriculum Development and Education Content teams in the integration and creation of interactive digital media to support outreach and engagement via online and mobile platforms and applications, creating advertising content for social media, presentations, tutorials, media files, and dynamic content for email, web, and virtual environments.
  • Utilizes emerging technologies to create interactive customer experiences.
  • Support User Experience (UX) Design by developing digital content that prospective students, parents, educators, and donors interact with (click, watch, subscribe, like, share) in collaboration with Curriculum Development members and the Instructional Designer.
  • Support Donor Experience (DX) by developing digital content that meets information and engagement needs, and provides donors and patrons with positive experiences with media pertaining to the Save The Water(tm) brand.
  • Collaborate on producing documentation and presentations for Education materials required to support digital fundraising and public awareness initiatives, partnerships, and special projects.
  • Communicate with Multimedia Specialist(s) and other team members to ensure timely completion and delivery of digital media content development projects.
  • The incumbent will work with the Curriculum Development Manager and subject matter experts to develop digital fundraising and public awareness materials (videos, presentations, tutorials, infographics, GIFS, etc.). Working collaboratively, the incumbent will participate in consultative decision-making regarding the integration of digital media content to support curriculum development and public awareness activities.
  • The incumbent will design specific education and/or materials that will be part of campaigns, including storyboard development, and integrating content with media elements, which will facilitate and support the donor, student, and educator engagement process.
  • The incumbent will work collaboratively with the Curriculum Development and Education Content teams to support digital fundraising and public awareness strategies that integrate digital media technologies.
  • Be willing to attend virtual meetings in the EST timezone (GMT -4:00) and respond to emails within 36 hours.

Content Design and Development

  • Designs and produces multimedia digital content required to support digital outreach and engagement initiatives. This position is focused on the development of digital content, including educational videos, promotional images for email and social media campaigns, virtual environments, and webinar presentation slides. The position requires strong project management and decision-making skills as well as specialization in effective multimedia production and content. The goals include spreading awareness as well as promoting audience engagement on digital advertising platforms and social media channels.
  • Consult with the graphic designers and illustrators on the design of artwork for multimedia public awareness and education materials. Customize approved templates for different platforms in consultation with the Curriculum Development Manager and other relevant stakeholders. The incumbent provides technical and creative advice and assistance to satisfy stakeholder needs and meet audience requirements while meeting Save The Water(tm)â€™s brand standards. The incumbent is responsible for the core duties in this category daily:
  • Produce engaging content for Education Group digital and social media channels.
  • Design customized digital materials requested by the Curriculum Development Manager for digital media projects.
  • Create and edit videos from pre-production to post-production for online distribution.
  • Assist in producing media, i.e. video interviews, instructional videos, etc.
  • Develop innovative, creative, and original design ideas for multimedia public awareness and education materials (i.e., ads, videos, GIFs, testimonials, virtual booths).
  • Search for creative commons and royalty-free digital assets such as stock photos, videos, vectors, etc.
  • Develop eye-catching digital content that students, parents, educators, and partners interact with (click, watch, subscribe, like, share).
  • Design digital media that encourages interactive donor and/or student/ educator experiences utilizing content created by the Education Group.

Digital Media Engagement Support

  • Collaborate with the team in resolving roadblocks and support planning and decision-making; work with the Curriculum Development team as needed to develop solutions and initiatives to achieve project goals.
  • Use media databases to find, store, and send files (Google Drive, etc.).
  • Support multimedia presentations, virtual conferences, consultations, e-courses, and meetings with members of the Education Group and external partners. Collaborate with team members in other Groups at Save the Water on digital engagement activities.
  • Support the Education Group in maintaining brand standards set by the Marketing department. The incumbent maintains the organizationâ€™s visual identity, colors, graphic elements, text on-screen styles, etc. to maintain a strong and cohesive brand in all digital content.

Research and Analysis

  • Review current digital media content, and identify ways to make materials more engaging, and optimized for targeted audiences and platforms.
  • Research emerging technologies, new media, and design solutions and share recommendations, inspiration, and examples of engaging media.
  • Update knowledge and skills; keep abreast of new tools and technologies.

Other Duties and Responsibilities

  • Manage multimedia project needs and timelines in close communication with Multimedia Specialist(s), the Curriculum Development Manager, and other stakeholders.
  • Provide support for special projects in the Education Group.

EXPERIENCE/ REQUIREMENTS

  • Experience in creating different types of content.
  • Passion for producing media that creates a positive impact on students and educators.
  • Strong ability to self-motivate, multitask, and prioritize effectively.
  • Strong attention to detail in all aspects of work.
  • Strong project management and leadership skills.
  • Outgoing, persistent, and energetic. Strong communication and interpersonal skills; able to handle requests and complaints in a professional, non-confrontational manner.
  • Very comfortable working in a virtual team environment, incorporating group problem-solving; shares information and responsibility.
  • Proven ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced and online environment.
  • Demonstrate strong written and oral communication skills to elicit information and provide accurate information clearly and concisely.
  • Committed to attending team meetings. Strong relationship-building skills, both internally and externally.
  • Ability to follow directions and take initiative.
  • Comfortable learning and using a variety of technical solutions to complete project deliverables.
  • A creative mind who values collaboration, contribution, and implementation of original ideas.
  • Experience using Google product applications or G Suite.
  • Experience with Adobe Creative Suite, particularly Premiere Pro and Photoshop.

EDUCATION

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree (or in progress) in Media and Communications, Digital Marketing, Education Technology, Instructional Design, or similar, equivalencies of education and experience may also be considered.
  • A strong understanding of copyrights, copywriting, the APA style, and natural and environmental science, or other related fields.

HOW TO APPLY:

If interested, please submit your resume to newvolunteers@savethewater.org. We would love to hear from you!

listings.name: Dyer Park Tree Planting
listings.description:
Community Greening, the Florida Forest Service, and PBC Parks are continuing the transformation of the walking & biking trails at Dyer Park in West Palm Beach on Saturday, December 13th, by planting another 100+ native shade trees!

These trees will provide cooler temperatures and much needed shade for walkers and bikers using the trails, and we need YOUR help to get them in the ground!

CG Arborists and our trained Tree Technicians will be on hand to lead the group, and guide/assist volunteers. No experience needed, and all skill levels and physical capabilities welcomed. We encourage anyone to join us who is interested in getting their hands a little dirty, while helping a great cause.

Community Greening will provide all of the tools needed, have work gloves to borrow, as well as water and light snacks. Weâ€™ll even have a DJ on-site to keep things fun!

Please wear closed-toe shoes, and clothing that can get a little dirty. We also encourage you to wear a hat and sunscreen.

Families are welcome, all minors must be accompanied by a parent/guardian for the entire duration. Event begins at 10am, and estimated to finish at noon.

Dyer Park is located in West Palm Beach. The Mountain Bike & Walking Trail is located towards the back of the park, past the softball fields and playground â€“ 7301 N Haverhill Rd, West Palm Beach, FL 33407.

Volunteers must sign-up in advance at: https://communitygreening.org/events/dyer-park-tree-planting-121325

listings.name: Website Developer / Webmaster Developer
listings.description:
• This is an unpaid volunteer opportunity.
  • The Website Developer / Webmaster Developer is expected to contribute at least 5 hours per week and respond to emails within 36 hours.

SUMMARY

Reporting to the Director of Technology, the Website Developer / Webmaster Developer is responsible for supporting the migration of STWâ„¢â€™s website from Bluehost â†’ WordPress â†’ Webflow, ensuring that all content (including blogs, articles, and media) is properly backed up and transferred without loss. The incumbent will implement best practices in website migration, safeguard data integrity, and support ongoing maintenance of the Webflow CMS and hosting environment.

The Website Developer / Webmaster Developer will collaborate with the UX/UI Designer and other team members to ensure a smooth transition to Webflow and provide long-term technical support for the nonprofitâ€™s website infrastructure. This role requires strong attention to detail, initiative, and the ability to troubleshoot issues effectively.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Manage backups and ensure preservation of all blog and article content.
  • Support the WordPress backend including plugins, exports, and troubleshooting.
  • Migrate and configure content within Webflow hosting + CMS.
  • Provide ongoing Webflow support following migration.
  • Collaborate with team members to ensure smooth transition and consistent website performance.
  • Attend virtual meetings in the EST timezone (GMT -4:00) and respond to communications within required timelines.
  • Perform other duties as assigned to support STWâ€™s technology infrastructure.
  • This role involves short-term migration support and long-term ongoing Webflow maintenance.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience in WordPress migration and backup processes.
  • Familiarity with Webflow CMS setup, hosting, and maintenance.
  • General web development experience, including troubleshooting and content management.
  • Strong organizational skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Ability to prioritize effectively, self-motivate, and meet deadlines in a remote environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Comfortable working in a collaborative, virtual team environment.
